name: Limit Definition
latex: \lim_{x \to a} f(x) = L \text{ means } \forall \epsilon > 0, \exists \delta > 0 \text{ such that } |x - a| < \delta \implies |f(x) - L| < \epsilon
explanation: A limit describes the behavior of a function as its input approaches a particular value. Informally, lim(x→a) f(x) = L means f(x) gets arbitrarily close to L as x gets close to a. The formal epsilon-delta definition provides a rigorous mathematical foundation. Limits are fundamental to calculus, as derivatives and integrals are defined using limits.
